CatDescriptText: Alter Howard Jr., Homewood and Frank Esherick, salesman, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, December 24, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think that President-elect Kennedy was sincere in offering Congressman William Dawson, of Chicago, the cabinet position of Postmaster-General?"  Mr. Howard's answer reads: "I think President-elect Kennedy was sincere, and he made a nice move.  Also, I believe, Congressman Dawson made a nice move.  I think he can better serve his country and his people by staying in the position which he has, now."  Mr. Esherick's answer reads: "President-elect Kennedy would not have made the appointment if he were not sincere."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Alter Howard Jr. wearing scarf and hat, standing on Wood Street with RAAB Clothes sign in background, Downtown; Portrait of Frank Esherick wearing textured coat, standing in front of store window, Wood Street, Downtown
